content.description: Climb the face just left of the "cannonball hole" in the wall up to the widest point of the roof. Pull the strenuous roof about 5 feet right of the "Sunset Overhang" roof crack and then climb the face to the top.
content.location: Below the widest point in the roof to the left of the "cannonball hole" about 15 feet up the face.

content.description: Climb straight up the thin, tweaky face using small left facing edges to a crux at mid height. Also known as "Rubbin' the Nubbin'".
content.location: Located about 5 feet right of "Crimper".

content.description:
Start on two pockets, dyno up and right, place some gear, move straight up, place some gear, move up and slightly left, place a bomber #1 then send the top crux. The route has two cruxes, bottom and top. This is a top out route. You can walk off.

Bring a crash pad or two incase you blow the bottom or middle.

The top out hold is always dirty with hemlock needles. Go up and clean it off first, or you'll hate your life when you reach for the last crux hold and its dirty.
content.protection: 4, .5, 1 There are only three places for gear.
content.location: Tucked in an alcove past sunset wall behind a small hemlock tree. To the right of an obvious wide dihedral crack.

content.description: The left most route on Sunset Wall near the left end of the roof. Follow the black streak past a few horizontal cracks to the roof. Climb through the roof at the obvious crack and then a few more moves to the top. If going for the lead, be aware that the middle section of this climb can't be protected. However, the crux up high is well protected.
content.protection: Standard rack or toprope from tree anchor
content.location: The left end of Sunset Wall near the left end of the roof at a black streak.

content.description: Climb easy rock to a series of flakes and pull a few cruxy moves, then climb easier rock to the top. Also known as "Absolutely Nubbin".
content.location: On the face just to the left of the "Into the Sunset" Chimney.

content.description: Climb up some right facing flakes, move left a few feet, and continue straight to the top of the cliff aiming just to the right of the blocks leaning over the edge of the cliff. You can also climb a direct start about 6 feet left of the original start making the climb a grade harder
content.location: Located about 10 feet right of Copenhagen on some right facing flakes.

content.description: Climb the face just right of the "cannonball hole" in the wall up to the flake in the roof. Climb out the roof crack and then climb the face to the top.
content.location: Below the flake in the roof to the right of the "cannonball hole" about 15 feet up the face.

content.description: Stand start on the "Rhino horn". Â Ascend the mini-dihedral just right of the arete to an exposed top out.
content.location: The farthest right arete on Sunset Wall

content.description: Climb the thin reachy face through a bulge up to the roof. Pull the roof at the crack and climb to the top.
content.location: The face directly below the roof crack about 5 feet to the right of the flake on "Roof Flake".

content.description: Toprope or boulder the short face at the right end of Sunset Wall. Climb the face past a flake to the top.
content.protection: Toprope from tree anchor or pads if bouldering
content.location: The short face at the very right end of Sunset Wall.

content.description: Fun full-body chimney. A few ledges to start off and edges to finish with, but full on body chimney in the middle section.
content.location: Set in the middle of Sunset Wall...pretty hard to miss.

content.description: Climb the face with vertical seams up to good ledges.
content.protection: Small to medium protection or toprope from tree anchor.
content.location: About 8 feet right of the Arch and about 20 feet left of Into the Sunset on Jimi Cliff wall. Just to the left of a tiny roof about halfway up the wall.

content.description: Boulder or toprope your way through a round pocket and some very thin edges to reach the top of this short route. Also known as "Lacuna".
content.protection: Toprope from tree anchor or pads if bouldering
content.location: Located below a round pocket about 6 feet right of "Stockholm".

content.description: Start just inside the chimney and ascend the blunt arete on the right side of the chimney. Tweak through some thin moves and a desperate mono pocket crux. This route was once 5.11 until a flake broke about halfway up.
content.location: The arete on the right side of the "Into the Sunset" chimney.

content.description: Start about 3 feet right of the chimney in a short left facing corner. Climb straight up avoiding all of the holds on Copenhagen except for one right hand sloper about halfway up the wall.
content.location: About 3 feet right of the chimney in a short left facing corner just off of the ground.

content.description: Start below a short vertical crack near the top of the wall and climb straight up the blank looking face. Finish by climbing the short vertical crack to the top.
content.location: Below a short vertical crack near the top of the wall, about 5 feet right of "Central Face Climb" and just to the right of a tiny roof about halfway up the wall.

content.description: Start about 7 feet right of the chimney and just below a few pockets that are 20 feet up the wall. Head straight up through the pockets and great crimpy face climbing.
content.location: 7 feet right of the chimney on Jimi Cliff just below the finger pockets.

content.description: The crux is pulling the roof. With fist and or hand and feet jams. Takenit straight up. Use the face holds to top out. After top out there is a 1 move v1 to get to top.  Not using the crack is a variation.  Tons of variations avalible. Dyno to the jug. To the left it becomes a small boulder field under be carefull.
content.protection: At least one crash pad. If u plan on taking the traverse over and up bring another.
content.location: The far left of sunset wall if your facing it. Climb down the acess for top rope.  Super easy to find follow main path.

content.description: This is a traverse of the entire Sunset Wall and the longest possible route at Coopers Rock at around 165 feet in length. You can climb the traverse at this grade by taking the path of least resistance and never getting more than 10 feet above the ground. Begin at a horn on the far right side of the wall and traverse left through several cruxes and rests to the far left side of the wall near the beginning of "Sunset Overhang". Listed as 5.9 in the old books.
content.protection: Pads in the bad landing areas
content.location: All of Sunset Wall.

content.description: Climb the obvious left leaning arch until it crests, then continue straight up and over the top on classic coopers rock ledge jugs.
content.protection: Top-route equip-able. Also leadable on trad gear
content.location: About 30 ft to the left of the chimney at jimi cliff

content.description: Follow a black streak up the rounded arete on the left side of the chimney. Avoid using the holds on "Stop 'N Go" until near the top.
content.location: The arete on the left side of the "Into the Sunset" chimney.
